items.sentence: Tom is a lighthouse keeper and leads a lonely life.
Tom is certain that Mary will come to school today.
Everyone\'s waiting to see what\'s going to happen.
Tom said he doesn\'t think that\'s going to happen.
Why didn\'t you tell me Tom couldn\'t speak French?
I suspect Tom and Mary have both agreed to do that.
I suspect that Tom and Mary were afraid to do that.
I think I can probably afford to buy a new trumpet.
How can you talk that way about your oldest friend?
How could Tom have done that without Mary noticing?
How could Tom possibly have known what I was doing?
How did Tom get Mary to help him with his homework?
How did you convince Tom to give you so much money?
Tom definitely had enough time to get the job done.
All I want is a cup of coffee and a piece of toast.
Tom and Mary drifted down the river in their canoe.
Tom didn\'t know anything about what was happening.
Were you playing footsie with each other at dinner?
Tom\'s French is easier to understand than Mary\'s.
Thousands of people became victims of this disease.
